intro: Audibertia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered audibertia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Audibertia grandiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
